intro: Pentachaeta, commonly known as the starless everlasting or desert star, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family, Asteraceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and Mexico. They are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow and sometimes pink. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Pentachaeta species are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making them resilient and hardy plants.
